column3: In 2015, there were partial shortages in the months of January, March, April, May and September, and a total shortage in February. In 2016, there were partial shortages in June, July, Novermber, and December and a total shortage in August.

column1: Is the BCG vaccination policy regularly assessed?

column3: BCG vaccination for all children between birth to the first month of life. A second dose is given to those with Hansen's disease/leprosy. BCG is contraindicated in children with HIV, but not in children who have been exposed to HIV at birth, as there is no confirmation of infection. Vaccine coverage is assessed every 4 months and the National Immunization Program recommends that municipalities with low adopt measures to achieve adequate coverage.
